channel.title: Michael Smith News
channel.description: Maureen's son, Katarina's husband and lapsed radio broadcaster's views.

item.title: NBN Co Ltd - its report to the Parliamentary Joint Committee on the NBN - all targets met, all projections equal to plan, mobile usage flat and fixed growing.
item.description: Mike Quigley is the CEO of NBN Company Limited and today he presented this report to the Commonwealth. Download NBN Co Report to Parliamentary Committee 19 apr 2013 Here's the front cover of the report The report declares that most of the cost and operational projections the NBN included in...
item.content:encoded:
Mike Quigley is the CEO of NBN Company Limited and today he presented this report to the Commonwealth.

Download NBN Co Report to Parliamentary Committee 19 apr 2013  

Here's the front cover of the report


 The report declares that most of the cost and operational projections the NBN included in its 2012-2015 Corporate Plan will be met to the dollar out to 2021.   Here's the capital spending projection:  


 Here's opex:  


But it's this chart that I found most revealing of the NBN Company's wish to cherry pick data to suit its own investments, rather than to invest to suit the market (that is you and me) and our buying behaviours.   

Figures in the Australian Bureau of Statistics' latest Internet Activity report show steady growth in wireless connections and fixed broadband:

  • There were 12.2 million internet subscribers in Australia at the end of December
    2012. This represents an increase of 1% since the end of June 2012 and an annual
    growth of 5%.
  • At 31 December 2012, there were 6.0 million mobile wireless broadband
    connections in Australia, an increase of 2% since the end of June 2012. Mobile
    wireless broadband was again the most prevalent internet technology in
    Australia, accounting for 49% of all connections.
  • The volume of data downloaded by fixed line broadband in the three months ended
    31 December 2012 increased by 35% compared with the three months ended 30 June
    2012. Data downloaded using wireless broadband also continued to grow, recording
    an 11% increase over the same period, to 28,196 Terabytes.

This is NBN Company Limited's only chart that compares mobile broadband with fixed broadband.  


 As an investor in NBN Co Ltd, do you feel that you have been fully briefed by the company's management on your investment?
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith

item.title: Bob Kernohan and I thought you might like to hear how he's going.
item.description: Here's a photo from a great day out I had with Bob near my home in Camperdown. The Newtown cemetery is just up the road and Bob was particularly taken with this fin from a ship's propeller that the men in the Morts Dock put together for their Engineer Foreman...
item.content:encoded: Here's a photo from a great day out I had with Bob near my home in Camperdown.  The Newtown cemetery is just up the road and Bob was particularly taken with this fin from a ship's propeller that the men in the Morts Dock put together for their Engineer Foreman John Leys on his death in 1883, "Erected by his fellow workers".
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith

item.title: Stu of NT has had Julia on the couch and his analysis of her Gonski fight-club behaviour is attached
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith

item.title: My 3-fold test for me and my family in The AWU Scandal
item.description: I've adopted a 3-fold test that I apply to myself every day in this pursuit of The AWU Scandal. 1. Will my involvement be a limited period of time, will it have an end? 2. Will I be wholly successful in having this matter properly investigated by a competent authority...
item.content:encoded:
I've adopted a 3-fold test that I apply to myself every day in this pursuit of The AWU Scandal.

1.     Will my involvement be a limited period of time, will it have an end?

2.    Will I be wholly successful in having this matter properly investigated by a competent authority and will justice be done?

3.    Will the result be worthwhile, will the whole exercise have been worth my effort and the sacrifice I have asked of my family?

If I could not answer yes to each of those 3 questions every day I would stop and would drop it.

In the interim, I have to get by - and that's why I ask you for your support in helping me pay the bills that constantly accrue.

Michael Smith

National Australia Bank

BSB 084855

A/C 537650476

Thanks,

Michael Smith

 

PS    I just did the PS cause that's what GetUP does.  Thanks for reading the PS.   And go justice.
item.dc:creator: Michael Smith
